intro: Synotis nayongensis, commonly known as the Philippine skyflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a sky filled with stars. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
